enhanced_by.reason: Both methods involve extracting text from elements, making 'text()' a suitable method for setting up similar test cases.
The 'hasText()' method checks if an element has text, which is similar to the condition used in 'eachText()' to filter elements with text.
The 'text()' method returns combined text of all matched elements, which can be used to verify the correctness of the text extracted by 'eachText()'.
The 'hasText()' method can be used to assert that elements with text are correctly identified and processed by 'eachText()'.
